pages.text:
April 2025 County of Marin EMS BLS PR 9
SELF ADMINISTRATION OF
NERVE GAS AUTO-INJECTOR
Indications
• Exposure to nerve/chemical agents (Sarin, Suman, Tabun, Vx) exhibiting signs and symptoms
that may include the following:
• S.L.U.D.G.E.M.- Salivation, Lacrimation, Urination, Defecation, Gastrointestinal pain and gas,
Emesis, Miosis
Contraindication
Not to be administered as a prophylactic to nerve agents
Equipment
Nerve Gas Auto Injector
(Atropine and Pralidoxime)
Mild symptoms of exposure Severe symptoms of exposure
• Blurred vision, miosis • Strange or confused behavior
• Excessive, unexplained teary eyes • Severe difficulty breathing or copious
• Excessive, unexplained runny nose airway secretions
• Increased salivation, drooling • Severe muscular twitching and general
weakness
• Chest tightness/difficulty breathing
• Tremors/muscular twitching • Involuntary urination and defecation
• Nausea, vomiting • Convulsions
• Unexplained wheezing/cough • Unconsciousness
• Acute onset of stomach cramps
• Tachycardia or bradycardia
Immediately administer three injections into
Administer one injection into the mid-lateral the mid-lateral thigh in rapid succession
thigh if patient experiences two or more
MILD symptoms of exposure. Wait 10-15
minutes for medication to take effect
If after 10-15 min. no severe symptoms develop
• No additional injections are recommended.
If after 10-15 min. any severe symptoms develop
• Give 2 additional injections in rapid succession.
Transfer care to ALS personnel as soon as possible.
